meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: Apple v. Samsung juror Manuel Ilagan said the nine-person jury that heard the patent infringement case between the companies knew after the first day that it believed Samsung had wronged Apple.

div.a: New iPad Mini To Debut In October

div.div: Apple’s next generation iPhone and its so-called “iPad mini” will debut at two separate events this fall, rather than a single one as has been widely speculated, according to several sources.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SAU4K4&via=Digg&text=New iPad Mini To Debut In October

div.a: The NSFW Social Media Platform The Internet's Been Waiting For

div.div: MakeLoveNotPorn.tv, aims both to shake up the status quo of expected online adult entertainment and to encourage free and open discourse about the erstwhile taboo topic of sex.

li.div: Well it's about time RT @Gizmodo: A new, NSFW kind of social content-sharing @makelovenotporn gizmodo.com/5937150/makeloveno...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PhXjmi&via=Digg&text=The NSFW Social Media Platform The Internet's Been Waiting For

div.a: Students Make Real Lava In Parking Lot

div.div: What if you could get up close and personal with a real-life, mesmerizing lava flow—minus the imminent personal danger?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OAcmbY&via=Digg&text=Students Make Real Lava In Parking Lot

div.a: The Agonies And The Ecstasies Of Parking In New York

div.div: Parking in New York—it sends you to ecstasy or rips your heart out. Which is to say, it’s a natural continuation of family life.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/MP9nxY&via=Digg&text=The Agonies And The Ecstasies Of Parking In New York

div.a: Jihadist Websites Target Navy SEAL Author

div.div: It only took one day for Fox News to identify the ex-Navy SEAL responsible for a new book on the death of Osama bin Laden. It took even less time for Al Qaeda-affiliated websites to begin distributing his name and image while calling for his "destruction."
Neil Armstrong, the first man to walk on the moon, died Saturday, weeks after heart surgery and days after his 82nd birthday.

div.a: Why The Police Shot Civilians At The Empire State Building

div.div: An unnamed law enforcement official told the New York Times that most or all of the injuries came from the 16 rounds police fired at Johnson. Johnson, detectives speculated to the Times, probably got off one shot at police.

li.div: The best rebuttal to the argument that more guns would help thwart psychopathic shooters buzzfeed.com/joeflood/why-...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R8PoXJ&via=Digg&text=Why The Police Shot Civilians At The Empire State Building

div.div: It’s basically a computer you can wear on your hands.

div.a: The Robots We Build To Kill For Us

div.div: A roundup of the latest bots and what they can do.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OAl9uC&via=Digg&text=The Robots We Build To Kill For Us

div.div: Some of the coolest, cleanest versions of the Westeros house sigils we've seen.

div.a: Extraordinary Photographs Of Animals Inside The Womb

div.div: Using revolutionary four-dimensional scanning technology, scientists have shed light on the world of mammals inside the womb, including that of dolphins, sharks, dogs, penguins, and elephants.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Og36v1&via=Digg&text=Extraordinary Photographs Of Animals Inside The Womb

div.a: First Clips From New 'Star Wars' TV Series

div.div: George Lucas says he can’t yet figure out how to budget his already-written live-action “Star Wars” series (the one set between “Revenge of the Sith” and “A New Hope”), but apparently he has no trouble mounting “Star Wars” cartoons.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P5Ycga&via=Digg&text=First Clips From New 'Star Wars' TV Series

div.div: TOO MUCH EFFORT TO EAT WHOLE BOX

div.a: We've Been Using Tic Tac Containers All Wrong

div.div: This was huge news in 1995 when people still ate Tic Tacs.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U1yUEK&via=Digg&text=We've Been Using Tic Tac Containers All Wrong

div.a: Facebook HQ's New Building To Be Designed By Guggenheim Architect

div.div: Share price be damned, Facebook is expanding. It’s just announced that Guggenheim Museum architect Frank Gehry will design a 3,400 employee engineering office connected to its Menlo Park Headquarters by an underground tunnel.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TZXXYK&via=Digg&text=Facebook HQ's New Building To Be Designed By Guggenheim Architect

div.a: What Apple's Decisive Victory Over Samsung Means

div.div: After two and a half days of deliberations, the Apple vs. Samsung jury returned a decisive verdict in Apple's favor — holding that Samsung owes Apple $1.049 billion for copying Apple's intellectual property.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/MRuZK6&via=Digg&text=What Apple's Decisive Victory Over Samsung Means

div.a: How The Worst Things Imaginable Get Scrubbed From The Internet

div.div: There’s a lot of stuff on the internet, and every day more gets added to it. Not all of it is kosher. Child porn. Narco executions. Beheadings. So an invisible workforce has emerged to help scrub the festering filth, one that is often poorly paid, in entry-level positions with little support or job security.

li.div: Is this long enough to be a #longreads? (It is gut-sinking enough) buzzfeed.com/reyhan/how-ch...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SxgL3e&via=Digg&text=How The Worst Things Imaginable Get Scrubbed From The Internet

div.a: Game Over For Top Zynga Talent

div.div: While all eyes in the tech business world have largely been focused on Facebook lately, there’s another big player that has stumbled even more in recent months: Zynga.
